descriptions.content:
The main syntactic pattern for the use of adjectives is that they follow the noun that they modify. As a general rule, adjectives usually consist of a radical and a suffix, or else a doubled radical. The suffixes used to form adjectives include:

  • པོ་ Positive
  • པ་ Comparative
  • ཤོས་ Superlative and intensive
  • པ་ལ་ Admirative
  • དྲགས་ Excessive
  • ཙམ་ Attenuative
  • ཐག་ཆོད་ or སའི་ Intensives
  • ལོས་ Interrogative
  • Various expressive suffixes

For a complete treatment of adjectives, see the “Adjectives and Adjectival Phrases” section of this Reference Grammar. (xxlink)
